title: Opposition MP fires Govt. over move to renovate Prabhakaran’s ancestral home
byline: The government’s purported decision to renovate the ancestral home of slain LTTE leader Velupillai Prabhakaran has come under fire from the opposition in Parliament.

title: Sri Lankan marketers urged to ditch ‘gut feel’ for data-driven decisions
byline: Sri Lankan marketers are grappling with a critical inertia in adopting data-driven decision-making, often favoring “gut feel” over statistical analysis despite having the necessary academic background.

title: Accountants best placed to lead sustainability reporting: IFAC Chief
byline: Financial markets need trust worthy, high quality information on sustainability related risks and opportunities so that investors and lenders can make efficient decisions, said International Federation of Accountants (IFAC) President Jean Bouquot during his recent visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Response from the Hajj Committee to certain articles
byline: On behalf of the Hajj Committee, I wish to respond to the following two articles which appeared in the Lankadeepa and subsequently in the Daily Mirror, two newspapers which I subscribe to and respect.

title: Police take action against 4,826 traffic offenders
byline: Sri Lanka Police said that a total of 27,430 individuals were inspected yesterday (06) during daily search operations conducted across the country.

title: Appeal made to Mahanayake Theras over CEB VRS delay crisis
byline: A collective of approximately 2,200 employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) who have applied for the Voluntary Retirement Scheme (VRS) has made an urgent appeal to the Most Venerable Mahanayaka Thera of the Malwathu Chapter, the Most Venerable Mahanayaka Thera of the Asgiri Chapter, and the Advisory Executive Council of the Sangha, seeking immediate intervention over delays in implementing the scheme.

title: Showers, strong winds forecast across several parts
byline: Showers are expected to occur at times in the Uva Province and in the districts of Matale, Nuwara Eliya, Ampara and Batticaloa, the Meteorological Department said.

title: 40,000 prisoners crammed into space sufficient for 10,500
byline: Former Prisons Department Spokesman, Lion Jagath Chandana Weerasinghe, said heavy congestion prevails in prisons across the country, noting that 40,000 prisoners are being detained nationwide in facilities with a capacity of only 10,500.

title: Prez gets tough; no salary hike till 2027 whoever strikes
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake yesterday stressed that no allowances will be given for public sector employees until the third instalment of the salary increment is given in 2027, whoever resorts to strikes or takes to the streets.

title: Trump removes video with racist clip depicting Obamas as apes
byline: US President Donald Trump has removed a social media video which included a racist clip depicting Barack and Michelle Obama as apes.

title: Sri Lanka’s foreign employment industry in crisis
byline: The Association of Licensed Foreign Employment Agencies (ALFEA), designed as Sri Lanka’s intellectual firewall against corruption and misconduct in the foreign employment trade, is failing legally powerless despite its statutory mandate.

title: UK has moral duty toward Malaiyaha Tamils, says Mano Ganesan
byline: Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) Leader and MP Mano Ganesan has urged the United Kingdom to acknowledge and act on what he described as its historic and moral responsibility toward Indian-origin Malaiyaha Tamils in Sri Lanka.

title: Faheem Blitz Saves Pakistan from Dutch Shock
byline: Faheem Ashraf pulled off a late blitz as Pakistan narrowly escaped a Netherlands upset, winning by three wickets in Colombo on Saturday.

title: US wants Russia and Ukraine to end war by June, says Zelensky
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says the US wants the war with Russia to end by June, adding that both sides had been invited to the US for talks next week.

title: Hetmyer, Shepherd Power West Indies to Winning T20 World Cup Start
byline: West Indies began their T20 World Cup campaign with a commanding 35-run victory over Scotland at Eden Gardens, driven by a blistering half-century from Shimron Hetmyer and a match-winning five-wicket haul from Romario Shepherd.

title: 22-hour water cut scheduled in several areas of Kandy district
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced that a 22-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas of the Kandy District from tomorrow morning (08).

title: Parliamentary Pensions Repeal Bill to be debated on Feb 17
byline: The Parliamentary Business Committee has scheduled the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill for debate in Parliament on February 17, Leader of the House Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Suryakumar’s 84 leads India to opening win over USA in T20 World Cup
byline: A sparkling unbeaten 84 from India captain Suryakumar Yadav and three wickets from late call-up Mohammed Siraj in Mumbai on Saturday helped India to avoid a shock defeat to the United States as they opened their defence of the T20 World Cup.
